meanings.definition: To put an end to; suppress
meanings.sent1: She quashes the noise by closing the window.
meanings.sent2: The teacher quashes any disruptions in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The superhero quashes the villain's evil plans with ease.
meanings.sent4: His determination quashes any doubts that arise.
meanings.sent5: The extinguisher quickly quashes the small fire.

meanings.sent1: He quashes the grapes to make juice.
meanings.sent2: The chef quashes the garlic to release its flavor.
meanings.sent3: The toddler quashes the playdough into funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: The heavy book accidentally quashes the delicate flower.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the car quashes the soda can flat.

meanings.definition: To reject or deny (a legal motion)
meanings.sent1: The judge quashes the appeal due to lack of evidence.
meanings.sent2: The court quashes the lawsuit for lack of merit.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer quashes the objection with a strong argument.
meanings.sent4: The jury quashes the motion to dismiss the case.
meanings.sent5: The legal team quashes the opposing argument effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: The champion quashes all opponents in the tournament.
meanings.sent2: The army quashes the rebellion swiftly.
meanings.sent3: The team quashes the rumors of their defeat with a big win.
meanings.sent4: The hero quashes the monster threatening the town.
meanings.sent5: The skilled player quashes any doubts about their abilities.
